column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////We visited around 12 pm on a Tuesday and it wasn't busy when we arrived but about 20 minutes in
column2: it became very busy and loud. Our waitress was very nice and quick. We got the three cheese bread for our appetizer which was delicious! We ordered a small butter crust half pepperoni half cheese which we were quoted about 35-45 minutes for. I wouldn't recommend coming for deep dish if you're in a hurry as it takes quite a while to make. The pizza was just ok. I'm not a huge fan on sweet sauce and tons of cheese.
